citation.article-title: Reclassification of Leptospira parva Hovind-Hougen et al. 1982 as Turneriella parva gen. nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Comprises three genera, Leptospira, Leptonema and Turneriella, defined by differences in G+C content, DNA–DNA relatedness and 16S rRNA gene sequences.
The G+C contents of the genera Leptospira, Leptonema and Turneriella are 33–43, 54 and 48 mol%, respectively (Yasuda et al., 1987).
Other characteristics are as described previously (Hovind-Hougen, 1979; Johnson & Faine, 1984).
The type genus is Leptospira Noguchi 1917.
